messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] age limits on restrooms

messages.messageBody:
One of our malls here has put in two family bathrooms,
with a big toilet and 
a little potty-sized toilet, a big sink and a little
preschool-sized sink, 
and a little carseat-like seat you can strap your tiny
toddler into while you 
go so they're not puddling in the other toilet. :-) I
love it! I take 
people there just to see the restrooms! 

:-) Diane

They have those strap-in seat things at the swimming
pool we go to. My little-un loved it! was very handy
with 2 under 2yo...

Tracy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] age limits on restrooms
messages.msgSnippet: One of our malls here has put in two family bathrooms, with a big toilet and a little potty-sized toilet, a big sink and a little preschool-sized sink, and a
messages.messageBody:
One of our malls here has put in two family bathrooms, with a big toilet and
a little potty-sized toilet, a big sink and a little preschool-sized sink,
and a little carseat-like seat you can strap your tiny toddler into while you
go so they're not puddling in the other toilet. :-) I love it! I take
people there just to see the restrooms!

:-) Diane

> More and more newer bathrooms found in malls and such are using the "family"
> bathroom. I think this is great!

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] age limits on restrooms
messages.msgSnippet: More and more newer bathrooms found in malls and such are using the family bathroom. I think this is great! And its about time! My problem with this was that
messages.messageBody:
More and more newer bathrooms found in malls and such are using the "family"
bathroom. I think this is great! And its about time! My problem with this was
that my then 4-5 yr old never wants to wait until the rest of us are finished,
and is always trying to unlock the door. Therefore, my potty breaks have always
been done as quickly as the consumption of my food during a lunch break. I only
wish I had the energy level that kids do.

messages.subject: age limits on restrooms
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/12/01 9:07:37 PM, tn-k4of5@idahopagan.com writes:  I ve seen a couple, but I m
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/12/01 9:07:37 PM, tn-k4of5@... writes:

<< I have never seen such a sign here in the US. >>

I've seen a couple, but I'm wondering if they were in airports in Canada or
England. I think it was something about the age of eight years. I'd be more
worried about a little girl in the mens' room than the other way around.
More and more places have "family restrooms" which lock at the main door, so
a dad can take a little girl or a mom can take a baby AND a shy bigger boy.
Sometimes girls need help and dads REALLY can't go in the ladies' room. It's
a problem.

Sandra
